006.synopsis: This drow was petrified by a spectator. He's a bit cheekier than the others, likeable and chill.Now he is unpetrified.Worries about his companions and the group's leader - the wizard.Leave after a long rest.
006.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. peace3. loadlevel WLD_Main_A4. goto 114.477; 51.282; -2435. create OBJ_Oil_Of_The_Basilisk6. Apply it on the petrified drow7. Ctrl Shift K the Spectator (if he's attacking you)8. Speak to the Drow

Wizard.synopsis: Drow Wizard that has some info about the Adamantine Furnace.Paranoid after being petrified by the spectator.narrative feature: Used to kill his oponents and interrogate them afterwards (Disguise Self + Speak With Dead).
Wizard.how_to_trigger: repro steps: 1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. god on4. goto 112.431; 50.914; -249.5525. CTRL-Shift-K spectator (and hook horror if included in combat)6. Dialog starts automatically

CINE_SpectatorReveal.synopsis: This is a Combat Cutscene Dialog. A spectator rises from a chasm.
CINE_SpectatorReveal.how_to_trigger: goto 122 -236Climb wall section up to next levelDialogue will trigger (followed by combat in gameplay)

MemoryCrystal.synopsis: This dialogue is for an artefact called a Memory Shard, a crystal taken from the Petrified Drow (Dhourn).The crystal can store memories - in this case, Dhourn's knowledge of the location of the Adamantine forge. The player either approaches knowing what it is, or can discover its function based on a check.
MemoryCrystal.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. god on4. goto 118.74, 50.67, -247.325. Move around and killcombat when spectator attacks.6. Loot Dhourn's corpse.7. Open the inventory and use the Crystal.

002.synopsis: This drow was petrified by a spectator.Now he is unpetrified.Worries about his companions and the group's leader - the wizard.Leave after a long rest.
002.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. peace3. loadlevel WLD_Main_A4. goto 120.375; 53.412; -2555. create OBJ_Oil_Of_The_Basilisk6. Apply it on the petrified drow7. Ctrl Shift K the Spectator (if he's attacking you)8. Speak to the Drow

003.synopsis: This drow was petrified by a spectator.Now he is unpetrified.Worries about his companions and the group's leader - the wizard.Leave after a long rest.
003.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. peace3. loadlevel WLD_Main_A4. goto 126.053; 45.243; -2275. create OBJ_Oil_Of_The_Basilisk6. Apply it on the petrified drow7. Ctrl Shift K the Spectator (if he's attacking you)8. Speak to the Drow

Dead_Wizard.synopsis: SwD with Dhourn (leader of the petrified Drow).You can learn from this dialog about:- Forge- Memory Crystal and Activation Word for it;- Xagrism (one of his frenemies)
Dead_Wizard.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. god on4. goto 119.015; 50.636; -2455. killcombat6. addDebugSpell Target_SpeakWithDead Singular SpellSlot None7. infiniteAp8. Use Speak with Dead on Dhoum.

004.synopsis: This drow was petrified by a spectator.Now he is unpetrified.Worries about his companions and the group's leader - the wizard. He should seem in shock. Short sentences, short delivery.Leave after a long rest.
004.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. peace3. loadlevel WLD_Main_A4. goto 131.852; 49.695; -235.9485. create OBJ_Oil_Of_The_Basilisk6. Apply it on the petrified drow7. Ctrl Shift K the Spectator (if he's attacking you)8. Speak to the Drow1. One variation is use oe und_pd_freedrow. Then talk to Tecothy (S_UND_PetrifiedDrow_004).2. Second variation  is use oe und_pd_freedrow. Then ctrl+shift+K on Dhourn (S_UND_PetrifiedDrow_Wizard) to kill him before talking to Tecothy.3. Third variation is use goto 121; -235, then use god on, addDebugSpell Target_UND_Spectator_UnpetrifyingRay, and infiniteAp. Climb up the rocks to the north. A Spectator will appear and you will enter battle. Use the unpetrifying ray spell on Tecothy. Then Ctrl+Shift+K on Dhourn, Spectator, and Hook Horror. Then talk to Tecothy.4. There is a fourth variation where Dhourn is still petrified after the battle. I could not figure this out.

005.synopsis: This drow was petrified by a spectator. And will still feel a bit sick when he's woken up. Disoriented somewhat.Now he is unpetrified.Worries about his companions and the group's leader - the wizard.Leave after a long rest.
005.how_to_trigger: Repro Steps:1. Start the game.2. laodlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto 105.957; 50.067; -2494. oe und_pd_freedrow5. Talk with Arcagh.

automatic_ordering.reasoning:
Several interdependencies are evident based on the session synopses and trigger instructions. First, the 'CINE_SpectatorReveal' session is a combat cutscene that features the spectator emerging from a chasm. In all the drow unpetrification sessions ('006', '002', '003', '004', and '005'), the trigger instructions mention using an unpetrifying method (often involving the spectator being attacked or deactivated). This indicates that the spectator’s appearance (as seen in 'CINE_SpectatorReveal') is a prerequisite for any subsequent unpetrification dialogue with the drow. Moreover, these five sessions (006, 002, 003, 004, and 005) all essentially narrate the rescue of a petrified drow with subtle differences (shock, disorientation, etc.) and are alternative representations of the same event. Therefore, only one of them would be experienced in a given playthrough and they are mutually exclusive with one another.

In addition, the 'Wizard' session features the drow wizard who provides information about the Adamantine Furnace. There is another session, 'Dead_Wizard', in which you speak with Dhourn (the presumed leader and the wizard), but this session is only triggered if the wizard is killed (using Speak with Dead, for example). Hence the 'Wizard' session naturally comes before the 'Dead_Wizard' session, and a player’s choice leads to one or the other being experienced. Furthermore, the 'MemoryCrystal' session, which centers on a Memory Shard taken from Dhourn’s corpse, can only occur after the wizard (Dhourn) is dead. That makes 'Dead_Wizard' a necessary predecessor to 'MemoryCrystal'.

Summarizing the ordering and exclusivity:
• 'CINE_SpectatorReveal' must occur before any of the drow unpetrification sessions (006, 002, 003, 004, 005).
• The drow unpetrification sessions (006, 002, 003, 004, 005) are mutually exclusive alternatives.
• The 'Wizard' session should come before 'Dead_Wizard', as the latter indicates that the wizard has been killed.
• 'Dead_Wizard' must come before 'MemoryCrystal', since the Memory Shard is obtained from Dhourn’s corpse.
• Additionally, 'Wizard' and 'Dead_Wizard' are mutually exclusive outcomes (if the wizard survives his session, the dead variant does not occur, and vice versa).

006_0.speaker: Petrified Drow
006_0.text: Thanks for your help. I'll be on my way soon enough. Just need to decide where to.

006_2.speaker: Petrified Drow
006_2.text: Bloody wizard up and died on us, but my mates should be all right. Petrification'll wear off now that the spectator's dead... I hope.

006_7.speaker: Petrified Drow
006_7.text: Reckon the wizard'll be all right soon enough, now that creature's dead.

006_9.speaker: Petrified Drow
006_9.text: By Lolth... of course. Dhourn - damn.
006_9.context: NodeContext: Doorn, 'oo' like in 'boot'. He realizes he's here for Dhourn, then realizes he's dead

006_1.speaker: Petrified Drow
006_1.text: What a saga. We were hired by the wizard - looking for some forge.

006_6.speaker: Petrified Drow
006_6.text: Ran into some old buddy of his - Xargrim. Fight broke out, we had his back to a wall, but he summoned a - an enhanced spectator. Never seen anything like it.
006_6.context: NodeContext: XAR-grim. A bit of disbelief in his voice.

006_8.speaker: Petrified Drow
006_8.text: Well, that turned the tables. He ran off. Left us to deal with the bloody thing. I guess it's obvious what happened after that.

006_13.speaker: Player
006_13.text: Do you know anything else about Xargrim?

006_19.speaker: Petrified Drow
006_19.text: He's after the forge. Whatever's in there must be worth a lot of trouble.

006_5.speaker: Petrified Drow
006_5.text: Gotta get my mates free. We came in here together; we'll leave together.

006_4.speaker: Petrified Drow
006_4.text: Get our bearings. Make our way home. Hope we don't run into any more trouble.

006_12.speaker: Petrified Drow
006_12.text: Rest up. Go home. If I still have a home.

006_15.speaker: Petrified Drow
006_15.text: Thanks for your help. I... appreciate it. Truly. We'll be out of here in a little - soon as we get our bearings.

006_16.speaker: Petrified Drow
006_16.text: Dhourn's your man for a chat. I need to think.

006_18.speaker: Petrified Drow
006_18.text: Will head on out as soon as Dhourn's back in action.

006_20.speaker: Petrified Drow
006_20.text: Go on and sidle up to the wizard. He'll talk your ear off if you let him.

Wizard_6.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spitting in between words, enraged

Wizard_87.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_87.text: I offer to parley, and he brings a spectator? Twit. Quite ruined my ambush.

Wizard_134.speaker: Player
Wizard_134.text: Accustomed to a little more respect from a male.

Wizard_118.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_118.text: ... my apologies, mistress. I am still coming back to my senses.

Wizard_119.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_119.text: We simply haven't time for all of my titles.

Wizard_91.speaker: Player
Wizard_91.text: I'm more concerned with this 'twit' who set a spectator on you.

Wizard_69.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_69.text: Pah. A rival - a mere footnote to my legend. You should be more concerned with who I am.

Wizard_116.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_116.text: I am Dhourn. Third son of House Ba'Tol, first rank evoker, and initiate of Gravenhollow's...
Wizard_116.context: CinematicNodeContext: Trailing off at end as he reaches into pocket (off-screen)NodeContext: Trailing off at end as he reaches into pocket (off-screen)

Wizard_60.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_60.text: ... oh. Oh no no my dear dark GODS BELOW, NO!
Wizard_60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holding up a crystal in mute horror, its light shining dim

Wizard_108.speaker: Narrator
Wizard_108.text: *A memory shard. A container onto which brief mental impressions are projected, and stored for years at a time.*

Wizard_112.speaker: Player
Wizard_112.text: It's fading - it seems you've been frozen like that for a while.

Wizard_14.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_14.text: Far, far longer than I realised.

Wizard_82.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_82.text: Then my enemies have already found the forge. Which bastard stole my glory - Xargrim? Filro?
Wizard_82.context: CinematicNodeContext: Places memory shard back in his back pocket

Wizard_84.speaker: Player
Wizard_84.text: Neither bastard rings a bell, I'm afraid.

Wizard_93.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_93.text: The Adamantine Forge?  If it had been found, the name would ring throughout the Underdark.

Wizard_135.speaker: Player
Wizard_135.text: I haven't the slightest idea what you're talking about.

Wizard_58.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_58.text: Impossible. The master of the Adamantine Forge would be known - and feared - throughout the Underdark.

Wizard_63.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_63.text: Unless... hah. Hah! The fools must have turned back. Or better yet, died in the search. Good.

Wizard_136.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_136.text: If they had just surrendered their research to me, we might have found the forge together.

Wizard_88.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_88.text: But no - they hoarded their knowledge, left each of us clinging to scraps.

Wizard_147.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_147.text: I had the good sense to lock mine away in the memory shard. And now I can claim the forge alone.

Wizard_78.speaker: Player
Wizard_78.text: You'll claim nothing. Hand over the crystal - I'll take it from here.

Wizard_148.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_148.context: NodeContext: Furious at the suggestion, remembers he's talking to his betters

Wizard_48.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_48.text: I mean to say, mistress - I have undertaken this research myself, beholden to no house or hold.
Wizard_48.context: NodeContext: Continuing more diplomatically, through gritted teeth

Wizard_51.speaker: Player
Wizard_51.text: Every house is beholden to Lolth - as every male is beholden to their betters.

Wizard_90.speaker: Player
Wizard_90.text: I must have misheard you. Perhaps you'll speak louder from a rack in Menzoberranzan.

Wizard_0.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_0.text: Forgive me... mistress. I would of course be honoured to pass my research onto you.

Wizard_123.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_123.text: The memory shard answers to the pass-phrase 'Dhourn, Lord Archmage'.

Wizard_101.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_101.text: This memory shard holds the location of the lost Adamantine Forge. It answers to the pass-phrase 'Dhourn, Lord Archmage'.

Wizard_22.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_22.text: ... I... rather infuriatingly, I seem to have lost it. Should you locate it, the knowledge within can be unlocked with the pass-phrase 'Dhourn, Lord Archmage'.

Wizard_79.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_79.text: ... just an... aspiration for a wizard of my talents, mistress.
Wizard_79.context: NodeContext: Delicate dignity, but absolutely mortified.

Wizard_15.speaker: Player
Wizard_15.text: I'm above house politics myself - but I'll still kill for what I want.

Wizard_20.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_20.text: I've already been made a living statue for this damn crystal. A little pain will not deter me.

Wizard_25.speaker: Player
Wizard_25.text: HAND IT OVER, BOY. OR ELSE.

Wizard_125.speaker: Player
Wizard_125.text: House Ba'Tol, you said? You'll be welcomed back - all the male heirs died, I believe.

Wizard_76.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_76.text: ... then my brothers have perished in my absence? With no sons to replace them...

Wizard_137.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_137.text: Just an... aspiration, mistress. But if my house now has room to honour me as I deserve, I have no need to chase relics any longer.

Wizard_140.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_140.text: Take the shard, then - it holds the location of the lost Adamantine Forge. It answers to the pass-phrase 'Dhourn, Lord Archmage'.

Wizard_95.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_95.text: Take the shard then, please- only... I seem to have lost it.

Wizard_49.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_49.text: Hah, just as my fortunes turn for the better. Rather lucky for me - less so for you, mistress.

Wizard_38.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_38.text: But should you find it, mistress - the pass-phrase is 'Dhourn, Lord Archmage'. A rather... aspirational title, I know - but no longer needed.

Wizard_64.speaker: Player
Wizard_64.text: What knowledge does the crystal contain, exactly?

Wizard_97.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_97.text: Bold of you to ask. The others knew of the forge's defences, its operation... but I know where to find it.

Wizard_113.speaker: Player
Wizard_113.text: It sounds like you were each as bad as the other.

Wizard_138.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_138.text: Does it? Then I'll be sure to give my telling a little polish for the history books.

Wizard_80.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_80.text: I have plenty of time, now I'm the only one hunting for the forge. Or... almost the only one.

Wizard_19.speaker: Player
Wizard_19.text: Perhaps we can claim the forge together, split the proceeds.

Wizard_31.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_31.text: Enterprising of you - the others knew of the forge's defences, its operation... but I am the only one who knows its location.

Wizard_109.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_109.text: You proved your power in freeing me - but I need no more rivals. Try to take this as a compliment, yes?

Wizard_156.speaker: Player
Wizard_156.text: 'Alone'? Don't you still need your rivals' research?

Wizard_43.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_43.text: They knew of the forge's defences, its operation, true enough. But I know its location.

Wizard_34.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_34.text: The rest I can figure out with time, now I am the only one searching. Or... almost the only one.

Wizard_114.speaker: Player
Wizard_114.text: Do you speak of the Adamantine Forge? It's still hidden, as far as I know.

Wizard_83.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_83.text: Impossible. My rivals would have stopped at nothing.

Wizard_5.speaker: Player
Wizard_5.text: Xargrim's dead. His body's rotting in a myconid circle.

Wizard_115.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_115.text: Truly? Excellent - he might actually serve some purpose feeding fungus.

Wizard_102.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_102.text: We were friends once, three of us working together to find a lost wonder. Until the others grew jealous, began to guard their secrets.

Wizard_27.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_27.text: By any chance... did you find anything of interest on dear Xargrim's corpse?

Wizard_126.speaker: Player
Wizard_126.text: He had this manual on him.

Wizard_100.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_100.text: So the bastard was hiding something. Trust Xargrim to require instructions.

Wizard_71.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_71.text: I'll put them to better use. And, on the off chance you've read them yourself...

Wizard_41.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_41.text: Well. This knowledge is only useful so long as I am the only one who holds it. My apologies.

Wizard_59.speaker: Player
Wizard_59.text: Just a book. He had some particular literary tastes.

Wizard_105.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_105.text: Xargrim had no taste at all. But enough low cunning to use an illusion? Absolutely.

Wizard_55.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_55.text: And you fell for it. You clearly don't have the intellect to pose a threat... but you did  manage to kill a spectator.

Wizard_32.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_32.text: I simply cannot suffer another rival in this. So killing you is a compliment, if you think about it.

Wizard_111.speaker: Player
Wizard_111.text: You're asking if I robbed your friend?

Wizard_121.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_121.text: If you didn't, you're a fool. The dead have no use for what's in their pockets.

Wizard_35.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_35.text: In fact - you've served your purpose now, so allow me to demonstrate.

Wizard_129.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_129.text: Disappointing. But he's out of the way, so small blessings I suppose.

Wizard_151.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_151.text: Well. I have some business I am long overdue in completing, and I'm sure you have... something to do.

Wizard_44.speaker: Player
Wizard_44.text: Wait. I'll take that crystal of yours as thanks.

Wizard_40.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_40.text: ... you were so very close. If only you had just a little less cheek, I might have let you live.

Wizard_8.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_8.text: Hmm. Perhaps you are telling the truth. Perhaps not.

Wizard_89.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_89.text: I believe I'll have to kill you and ask again.

Wizard_132.speaker: Player
Wizard_132.text: Not your concern. Hand over your research - I'll take over from here.

Wizard_150.speaker: Player
Wizard_150.text: Xargrim's dead. His body's rotting in a myconid circle.

Wizard_26.speaker: Player
Wizard_26.text: Filro went mad. I had to kill him.

Wizard_81.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_81.text: Consider it mercy - or pest control. Filro was never fully right.

Wizard_106.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_106.text: Did he have anything...  interesting in his possession?

Wizard_85.speaker: Player
Wizard_85.text: Some text - but it's written in code.

Wizard_86.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_86.text: You release me and hand-deliver such a prize? I ought to keep you.

Wizard_39.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_39.text: But I'm afraid I can't. You've proven a little too resourceful, and I really can't suffer another rival for this prize.

Wizard_42.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_42.text: So try to take this as a compliment, yes?

Wizard_96.speaker: Player
Wizard_96.text: I decoded his notes - he'd written about some guardian of the Adamantine Forge.

Wizard_17.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_17.text: Well now. It seems his rather unique mind made itself useful. Clever of you to see through his cypher.

Wizard_139.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_139.text: A little too clever. I'd rather not lose one rival only to have another sprout in his place.

Wizard_74.speaker: Player
Wizard_74.text: Filro's gone mad. He joined a pack of hook horrors.

Wizard_94.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_94.text: Truly? Perhaps they've improved his manner.

Wizard_131.speaker: Player
Wizard_131.text: The Adamantine Forge? That was me, actually.

Wizard_68.speaker: Player
Wizard_68.text: I was exploring across the lake.

Wizard_53.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_53.text: ... do you know how many years we spent searching? Studying? For you to simply stumble on it?

Wizard_11.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_11.text: Gods. Gods. I might have to raise your corpse just so I can kill you twice.

Wizard_72.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_72.text: Why indeed. I think I'll find you easier to speak to once you're a corpse.

Wizard_65.speaker: Player
Wizard_65.text: Do you speak of the Adamantine Forge? It's still hidden, as far as I know.

Wizard_54.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_54.text: A memory shard. They hold their glow for years - and it's fading.

Wizard_103.speaker: Player
Wizard_103.text: All right. I'll let you get back to whatever this is.

Wizard_28.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_28.text: You don't understand. A memory shard ought to hold its glow for years - and look at it! It's fading.

Wizard_66.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_66.text: It contains knowledge that is precious to me. If it has grown this dull...

Wizard_130.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_130.text: ... my crystal. My memory shard. Where is it?
Wizard_130.context: NodeContext: Rising panic as he can't find an item we stole from him.

Wizard_18.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_18.text: You think it clever to steal from a statue, do you?
Wizard_18.context: NodeContext: To us, with suspicion and fury

Wizard_3.speaker: Player
Wizard_3.text: Ah, you must be the one Xargrim battled.

Wizard_75.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_75.text: 'Battled'? Please - that implies rivalry. He will but a footnote in my legend.

Wizard_157.speaker: Player
Wizard_157.text: I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. You're welcome for the rescue.

Wizard_142.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_142.text: Rescue. Helpless babes are rescued. I allowed you to assist me.

Wizard_13.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_13.text: Not to sound ungrateful, but you couldn't have saved some of my guards? I'm left to carry my own luggage.

Wizard_16.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_16.text: We'll be moving, just as soon as my guards are done moaning.

Wizard_37.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_37.text: I bid you luck at the forge. All that labour - not fitting for Dhourn, first son of House Ba'Tol.

Wizard_133.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_133.text: Away. I must gather my strength and free my companions here. I'm not going to carry my own luggage.

Wizard_154.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard_154.text: Respectfully - you have already taken my life's work. What else could you possibly need?

MemoryCrystal_3.speaker: Narrator
MemoryCrystal_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: CU on the stone sitting in player's hand. If possible, with a dull glow at the centre.

MemoryCrystal_20.speaker: Narrator
MemoryCrystal_20.text: *You heard its like described before - a memory shard, used to store brief mental impressions from the user's mind.*

MemoryCrystal_12.speaker: Narrator
MemoryCrystal_12.text: *You rack your brains but it is - for all intents and purposes - a particularly pretty rock.*

MemoryCrystal_4.speaker: Narrator
MemoryCrystal_4.text: *The crystal's glow swells, drawing you into its depths. You are transported - somewhere deep, loud, and hot as the Hells themselves.*
MemoryCrystal_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Zooming in on the crystal as it glows a little brighter - SFX of 'active forge' noise. Echoing hammer sounds, etc

MemoryCrystal_16.speaker: Narrator
MemoryCrystal_16.text: *Within the Underdark's bowels, beyond an ancient stronghold, hovers a giant hammer, waiting to fall.*
MemoryCrystal_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holds shot from previous node.

MemoryCrystal_11.speaker: Narrator
MemoryCrystal_11.text: *An echoing clang and you're back to yourself - left only with a firm sense of a place. A grand forge.*
MemoryCrystal_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Back to shot of player, as if startled from a reverie

MemoryCrystal_8.speaker: Narrator
MemoryCrystal_8.text: *The crystal probes back - and none too gently. You're left with a sudden and sinking feeling of inadequacy.*

MemoryCrystal_6.speaker: Narrator
MemoryCrystal_6.text: *Whoever you are, you are not worthy of the secrets within.*

MemoryCrystal_0.speaker: Narrator
MemoryCrystal_0.text: *You feel your consciousness stretch, reach out... and recoil as if at a bare-handed slap.*
MemoryCrystal_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Starting to zoom in on crystal in player's hand - then abrupt cut back to player

MemoryCrystal_10.speaker: Narrator
MemoryCrystal_10.text: *Yours is not the mind it was expecting.*

MemoryCrystal_17.speaker: Narrator
MemoryCrystal_17.text: *The crystal shines only faintly. A memory shard, the wizard had called it.*
MemoryCrystal_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: CU on the stone sitting in player's hand. If possible, with a dull glow at the centre.

002_19.speaker: Petrified Drow
002_19.text: Gh'rack! A pity Dhourn cannot say the same.

002_6.speaker: Player
002_6.text: Did you pick a fight with that spectator?

002_22.speaker: Petrified Drow
002_22.text: I came here with the wizard Dhourn. He vowed to share his fortunes in exchange for protection.

002_16.speaker: Petrified Drow
002_16.text: A man called Xargrim stepped from the shadows. They argued until their words turned to screams. Xargrim summoned the spectator - and fled.

002_8.speaker: Petrified Drow
002_8.text: An unusual spectator at that, adept at petrification. I was... unprepared.

002_15.speaker: Player
002_15.text: A word of thanks would not be out of order.

002_25.speaker: Petrified Drow
002_25.text: You still breathe after taking that tone. Let that be your thanks.

002_5.speaker: Player
002_5.text: What did Xargrim and Dhourn fight about?

002_14.speaker: Petrified Drow
002_14.text: I hardly paid notice. There was talk of a pact - and a forge, as I recall.

002_11.speaker: Player
002_11.text: Where will you go from here?

002_4.speaker: Petrified Drow
002_4.text: I will free the others. And we will return home.

002_18.speaker: Petrified Drow
002_18.text: We will gather our wits and return to Menzoberranzan.

002_1.speaker: Petrified Drow
002_1.text: Home to Menzoberranzan, once I've caught my breath.

002_0.speaker: Petrified Drow
002_0.text: Now that the monster's dead, might it wear off...? You, begone - I must think.
002_0.context: NodeContext: The first bit said to themselves, then back to player with "Are you still here..."

002_13.speaker: Petrified Drow
002_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Coming to life to see his leader petrified, crying out.NodeContext: Door-n

002_17.speaker: Petrified Drow
002_17.text: Gh'rack! There's no time to waste. You must free Dhourn.

002_20.speaker: Petrified Drow
002_20.text: You have my thanks. That will suffice.

002_23.speaker: Petrified Drow
002_23.text: Must I repeat myself? Release Dhourn!

002_27.speaker: Petrified Drow
002_27.text: Ol zhah xunor, t'yin. Flesh once more.

002_12.speaker: Petrified Drow
002_12.text: Your spirit is mighty, and your will strong. Let these words alone be my thanks.

003_2.speaker: Petrified Drow
003_2.text: I - by the Demonweb, it has been so long.
003_2.context:
CinematicNodeContext: 
NodeContext: Exhausted after being petrified, and after fight. Should remain so throughout scene.

003_4.speaker: Petrified Drow
003_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Notices his leader has been slain, and calls out.NodeContext: Door-n

003_8.speaker: Petrified Drow
003_8.text: Dhourn... dead. I need to think.
003_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said soiftly to himself, slightly panicked because his wizard friend diedNodeContext: Door-n

003_10.speaker: Player
003_10.text: What were you thinking, fighting a spectator?

003_7.speaker: Petrified Drow
003_7.text: Came with the wizard - Dhourn. He was looking for treasure and promised a cut. Or so he said.

003_17.speaker: Petrified Drow
003_17.text: A rival of his popped out of nowhere. 'Xargrim'... something like that. Unpleasant fellow.

003_21.speaker: Petrified Drow
003_21.text: They had words. Nasty ones. Xargrim summoned the spectator. Never saw one like that - petrified us all.

003_16.speaker: Player
003_16.text: What were Dhourn and Xargrim fighting about?

003_11.speaker: Petrified Drow
003_11.text: Hard to tell - more spittle than words. Something about a forge, I think. Not certain though.

003_1.speaker: Petrified Drow
003_1.text: I need to free the rest. Somehow.

003_0.speaker: Petrified Drow
003_0.text: First I rest. Then... the long journey home.

003_14.speaker: Petrified Drow
003_14.text: The others are... Think, damn it, think.
003_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to himself, slightly panicked because his comrades are petrified

003_22.speaker: Petrified Drow
003_22.text: Talk to Dhourn. I... I must rest.

Dead_Wizard_24.speaker: Narrator
Dead_Wizard_24.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Dead_Wizard_9.speaker: Player
Dead_Wizard_9.text: What's this crystal I found on your body?

Dead_Wizard_29.speaker: Player
Dead_Wizard_29.text: How do I use this memory shard?

Dead_Wizard_33.speaker: Player
Dead_Wizard_33.text: What does this memory shard do?

Dead_Wizard_12.speaker: Player
Dead_Wizard_12.text: Why did you argue with Xargrim?

Dead_Wizard_35.speaker: Player
Dead_Wizard_35.text: What can you tell me about this forge?

Dead_Wizard_4.speaker: Player
Dead_Wizard_4.text: You were looking for a forge. What can you tell me about it?

Dead_Wizard_7.speaker: Player
Dead_Wizard_7.text: Where can I find the forge?

Dead_Wizard_31.speaker: Narrator
Dead_Wizard_31.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

004_1.speaker: Petrified Drow
004_1.text: Spectator's dead. The spell could fade...

004_12.speaker: Petrified Drow
004_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: To himself, still shockedNodeContext: Door-n

004_4.speaker: Petrified Drow
004_4.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Drow should look a bit fearful if possible
NodeContext: Said to himself. Door-n

004_7.speaker: Narrator
004_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drow should look a bit fearful if possible

004_8.speaker: Narrator
004_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: The drow should eye player warily

004_11.speaker: Narrator
004_11.text: *The drow says nothing more, his eyes wide with shock.*
004_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drow should look a bit fearful if possible

004_24.speaker: Player
004_24.text: Looks like the spectator got the best of you. Weren't you prepared?

004_19.speaker: Petrified Drow
004_19.text: Dhourn hired us. Promised riches. Then Xargrim came. Dhourn's old friend.

004_13.speaker: Petrified Drow
004_13.text: They fought. Loud and nasty. Xargrim summoned the spectator and ran.

004_14.speaker: Player
004_14.text: Tell me more about this fight between Dhourn and Xargrim.

004_23.speaker: Petrified Drow
004_23.text: First they argued. About a pact, a forge. Then came spells. You know the rest.

004_15.speaker: Player
004_15.text: You seem distressed. Will you be all right?

005_3.speaker: Petrified Drow
005_3.text: Thank you. Your help was... appreciated. We'll be leaving soon.

005_10.speaker: Petrified Drow
005_10.text: We can't  leave Dhourn behind. We'll find a way.

005_15.speaker: Petrified Drow
005_15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Still feeling the effects from having been petrified

005_4.speaker: Petrified Drow
005_4.text: Wizard Dhourn hired us... find a... forge.

005_0.speaker: Petrified Drow
005_0.text: Came across Xargrim... his friend - a fight broke out. He summoned a spectator. Fool.

005_6.speaker: Petrified Drow
005_6.text: He escaped. His spectator petrified us... somehow.

005_13.speaker: Player
005_13.text: What can you tell me about Xargrim?

005_12.speaker: Petrified Drow
005_12.text: The forge... he wanted the forge...

005_2.speaker: Petrified Drow
005_2.text: The others... need to get them out...

005_8.speaker: Petrified Drow
005_8.text: Rest. Go home. Soon as the others are ready.

005_18.speaker: Petrified Drow
005_18.text: I appreciate your help. I'll be leaving... soon enough.

005_19.speaker: Petrified Drow
005_19.text: Others might be all right... now the spectator's dead.
